intro: Hyptis capitata var. vulgaris, commonly known as blue hyptis, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, clustered blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its visual appeal and ability to thrive in various soil conditions. Hyptis capitata var. vulgaris is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
